required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Study of the ANNE™ One System to Diagnose Obstructive Sleep Apnea
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Arm, Open-Label, Multi-Center, Comparative Study of the ANNE™ One System Versus Polysomnography and Home Sleep Apnea Testing to Diagnose Obstructive Sleep Apnea

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of this study is to evaluate the accuracy of the ANNETM One system for the diagnosis of obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) in adults.

detailed_description.textblock: The main objective of this study is to evaluate the accuracy of the ANNETM One system for the diagnosis of obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) in adults. Our primary hypothesis is that the ANNETM One system is non-inferior compared to polysomnography (PSG) for the diagnosis of obstructive sleep apnea. Our secondary hypothesis is that the ANNETM One system is non-inferior to home sleep apnea tests (HST) in the diagnosis of obstructive sleep apnea for patients who qualified for HST. Exploratory objectives include assessment of the diagnostic yield of the ANNETM One system worn over multiple sequential nights, repeatability of apnea-hypopnea index (AHI) calculations over multiple nights, and the predictive value of pulse arrival time to detect obstructive, central, and mixed apnea and hypopnea events.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: After consent, subjects will (1) wear the ANNETM One and HST for 1 night, (2) wear the ANNE One alone for 3 nights, and (3) wear the ANNE One during an attended PSG study for 1 night. The order of study nights for ANNE One and HST and ANNETM One alone will be randomized by each site in blocks of 2 and completed prior to the supervised PSG study.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparative diagnosis of ANNE system against Polysomnography
primary_outcome.description: The diagnosis of moderate or severe OSA by determining a patient's Apnea-Hypopnea Index (AHI) using the ANNE One system against the Polysomnography (PSG) over 1 night worn concomitantly. The ANNE One will be scored similarly with the system's onboard sensors as an alternative hypopnea and apnea sensor. The definition of mild, moderate, or severe obstructive sleep apnea is based on AHI. AHI < 5: Normal AHI ≥ 5 - <15: Mild AHI ≥15 - 30: Moderate AHI ≥ 30 Severe

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparative diagnosis of ANNE system against Home Sleep Apnea Test (HST)
secondary_outcome.description: The diagnosis of moderate or severe OSA by determining a patient's Apnea-Hypopnea Index (AHI) using the ANNE One system against the Home Sleep Apnea Test (HST) over 1 night worn concomitantly. The ANNE One will be scored similarly with the system's onboard sensors as an alternative hypopnea and apnea sensor. The definition of mild, moderate, or severe obstructive sleep apnea is based on AHI. AHI < 5: Normal AHI ≥ 5 - <15: Mild AHI ≥15 - 30: Moderate AHI ≥ 30 Severe

arm_group.description: Subjects will wear the ANNE One and HST for 1 night. This will serve to determine the diagnosis of moderate or severe OSA by determining a patient's Apnea-Hypopnea Index (AHI) using the ANNE One system against the Home Sleep Apnea Test (HST) over 1 night worn concomitantly

Subjects will wear the ANNE One during an attended PSG study for 1 night. This will server to determine the diagnosis of moderate or severe OSA by determining a patient's Apnea-Hypopnea Index (AHI) using the ANNE One system against the Polysomnography (PSG) over 1 night worn concomitantly
Subjects will wear the ANNE One only at home for 3 nights. This will serve for evaluation of AHI over multiple nights with the ANNETM One alone

intervention.description: After consent, subjects will (1) wear the ANNETM One and HST for 1 night, (2) wear the ANNETM One alone for 3 nights, and (3) wear the ANNETM One during an attended PSG study for 1 night.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥18 years old
- Any gender
- Any ethnic background
- Subjects with suspected OSA based on history and physical who qualify for, and have HST ordered, as determined by their regular provider
- Willingness to give written consent and comply with study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- An unstable medical condition, acute or chronic, that in the opinion of the investigator puts the subject at health risks related this trial or interferes with the clinical trial and data collection.
- Inability to understand instructions or operate device system
- Subject is pregnant, nursing or planning a pregnancy over the expected course of the study
- Subject has a skin abnormality that precludes assessment
- Subject has a history of dementia

patient_data.ipd_description: Data stored and used for future research will be de-identified. Data will not be used for future research outside of the scope of this study.
